Package gerberFileReader

Class GerberFileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • gerberFileReader.GerberFileReader
  • public class GerberFileReader
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to read and parse Gerber files into Java objects suitable for further processing.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GerberFileReader​(java.io.File file)
      Constructs a GerberFileReader for the specified file.

    • Method Summary

      Gets the stream of GraphicObjects described by the Gerber file.

      Gets the last exception that occurred during the parsing of the Gerber file.

      Gets the coordinate units specified by the Gerber file - either inches or millimeters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GerberFileReader

        public GerberFileReader​(java.io.File file)
                 throws GerberLayerFormatException
        Constructs a GerberFileReader for the specified file. It attempts to open the file and read the file header. When it returns, the file's attributes are available via the getFileAttributes() method and the coordinate units are available via the getUnits() method.
        Parameters:
        file - - the file to read
        Throws:
        GerberLayerFormatException - if the file can't be opened for reading or is not a valid Gerber file

    • Method Detail

      • parseFile

        public void parseFile()
               throws GerberLayerFormatException
        Parses the Gerber file on the current thread. When it returns, the graphics stream is available via the getGraphicsStream() method.
        Throws:
        GerberLayerFormatException - if an error occurs during the parsing of the file

      • parseFileInBackground

        public void parseFileInBackground​(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Double> showProgress,
                                  java.lang.Runnable runOnSuccess,
                                  java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Exception> runOnFailure)
        Parses the Gerber file on a background thread to generate its graphics stream.
        Parameters:
        showProgress - - (optional, set to null if not used) a call-back routine that gets called periodically on the event dispatch thread to show progress as the file is parsed. The call-back routine should have one parameter of type double which will vary from 0 to 1 as the file is parsed. Typically used to update a progress bar or percent complete display.
        runOnSuccess - - (optional, set to null if not used) a call-back routine that gets called when the file has been successfully parsed
        runOnFailure - - (optional, set to null if not used) a call-back routine that gets called if parsing of the file has failed for some reason. The call-back routine should have one parameter of type Exception which is used to pass back the exception that caused the failure.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels any parsing that is currently occurring on the background task.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Checks to see if parsing of the Gerber file has completed.
        Returns:
        true if parsing of the Gerber file has completed, false otherwise

      • isError

        public boolean isError()
        Checks to see if the parsing of the Gerber file has failed.
        Returns:
        true if parsing of the Gerber file has failed

      • getLastError

        public java.lang.Exception getLastError()
        Gets the last exception that occurred during the parsing of the Gerber file. The contents of the exception message may be examined to determine the exact cause of the exception.
        Returns:
        the last exception that occurred or null if no exception occurred

      • getUnits

        public Units getUnits()
        Gets the coordinate units specified by the Gerber file - either inches or millimeters.
        Returns:
        the units specified by the Gerber file

      • getGerberFile

        public java.io.File getGerberFile()
        Gets the Gerber file.
        Returns:
        the Gerber file

      • getGraphicsStream

        public GraphicsStream getGraphicsStream()
        Gets the stream of GraphicObjects described by the Gerber file.
        Returns:
        the stream of GraphicObjects or an empty stream if the file has not been parsed

      • getFileAttributes

        public AttributeDictionary getFileAttributes()
        Gets the Gerber file attributes. An empty dictionary is returned if the Gerber file does not have any file attributes.
        Returns:
        an AttributeDictionary holding the file attributes
